svg.desc: The chart shows the proportion of persons assessing their health to be “bad or poor” vs. “good or very good” in 2014 by 5 different income groups of the same size, so-called quintiles. The lower the income level, the higher the percentage of people who describe their health as “bad or poor”. On the lower end of the income scale, the 20 percent of people in Germany with the lowest incomes, one in four people consider their health to be “bad or poor”. On the top end of the scale, the top 20 percent in terms of income, it was only one in ten. Regardless of income, the percentage of people who report their health to be “good or very good” is higher than the share of those who assess their health as “bad or poor”.

div.p:
Source: Calculations by DIW Berlin, SOEPv32.1.
CC BY 4.0 Federal Government
The calculations refer to individuals aged 20-64 living in private households in Germany.
